item.title: Four antiviral strategies – includes vitamin D – Vasquez
item.description:
[The Proof is in the Panic:

We Need a New Strategy against Viral Infections](http://www.greenmedinfo.com/blog/proof-panic-we-need-new-strategy-against-viral-infections) GreenMedInfo

  1. Targeting the virus directly: Selenium, herbal tea licorice,

  2. Blocking viral replication : Vitamin D , Folic, betaine and S-adenosyl-methionine.

  3. Supporting immune function: of glutamine, whey protein isolate, vitamin A, vitamin D , fish oil, and zinc

  4. Supporting cellular and whole-body health: exercise, low-carbohydrate diets, coenzyme Q-10, lipoic acid, and acetyl-L-carnitine

Alex Vasquez DC ND DO FACN is the author of many books (including Functional Medicine Rheumatology, AntiViral Strategies and Immune Nutrition, and the recent 700-page textbook “Functional Inflammology: Volume 1”) and more than 100 publications in professional magazines and peer-reviewed medical journals, such as British Medical Journal (BMJ), Journal of Clinical Endocrinology and Metabolism, Journal of the American Medical Association (JAMA), Alternative Therapies in Health and Medicine, and Arthritis & Rheumatism, the Official Journal of the American College of Rheumatology.

item.title: CDC: Influenza vaccinations not expected to work well this year (but vitamin D should)
item.description:
CDC: Dominance of H3N2 viruses may portend more deaths this flu season LA Times Dec 4, 2014

  • “this year’s flu vaccines are a good match for only 48% of these H3N2 strains.”

  • As of Oct 1 82% were of the H3N2 variety

  • “Flu watchers first detected these strains in the U.S. in March. “

By then, “it was already too late to include them in this season’s vaccine,”
